caption: Talk show host Oprah Winfrey is pregnant with her first child at 61.

result.explanation: The image shows Oprah Winfrey with two dogs.  The caption claims she is pregnant. There is no visual evidence to support the pregnancy claim. Thus, the caption and image do not align.

candidates.title: FALSE: Oprah Winfrey Pregnant with First Child at 61
candidates.content:
Claim:
Talk show host Oprah Winfrey is pregnant with her first child at 61.
In early December 2015, the web site CelebTriCity published an article reporting that talk show host Oprah Winfrey was pregnant with her first child at the age of 61:
AFTER SEEING MARK ZUCKERBEG AND HIS WIFE GO THROUGH THERE PREGNANCY IT JUST INSPIRED ME TO HAVE MY OWN BABY"  OPRAH
Oprah Winfrey has more money ($3 Billion) than she will ever be able to spend in her lifetime, so choosing to have this child means her baby will be born a billionaire. She reportedly can't stop crying tears of joy as this is the one thing she has always wanted since she lost her baby at 14.
There is no truth to the above-quoted story. CelebTriCity is one of many fake news web sites currently operating on the Internet, and their disclaimer notes that CelebTriCity is "the most notorious entertainment website in the world" which publishes "shocking headlines" and a combination of "real & satire news" in order to keep its "visitors in a state of disbelief."
In addition to the site's disclaimer, readers could have determined that the above-quoted article was fake by checking it against other sources. Oprah has not made any pregnancy announcement on her social media accounts, nor has this rumor been covered by any major news publication.
[article-meta]
candidates.description: Talk show host Oprah Winfrey did not announce that she was pregnant with her first child at age 61.

result.explanation: The provided evidence directly contradicts the news caption. Snopes explicitly debunks the claim that Oprah Winfrey is pregnant with her first child at 61, citing the source of the rumor as a fake news website and the lack of confirmation from Oprah herself or major news outlets.
result.supporting_points: Source 1: Snopes article directly refutes the claim, stating that the rumor originated from a fake news website and has no credible evidence to support it.

final_result.explanation:
The claim that Oprah Winfrey is pregnant is demonstrably false based on both internal and external evidence.  The internal check, with a confidence score of 0, correctly identifies a mismatch between the image (Oprah with two dogs) and the caption (Oprah pregnant). The image provides no visual cues whatsoever to suggest pregnancy.  The lack of a visible baby bump, or any other physical indicators associated with pregnancy, strongly suggests the caption is inaccurate. The internal analysis concludes the caption is out of context because it's not supported by the image's content.

The external check provides overwhelmingly strong evidence against the caption's claim.  With a confidence score of 10, the external validation points to a Snopes fact-check article that definitively debunks the rumor. Snopes's high authority in verifying online claims and its direct refutation, citing the rumor's origin as a fake news website, leaves no room for doubt.  The lack of confirmation from Oprah herself or any reputable news source further strengthens the external evidence, reinforcing the falsity of the caption.

There is complete agreement between the internal and external checks. Both analyses strongly indicate that the caption is entirely out of context.  The image shows Oprah Winfrey with her dogs; the caption falsely asserts her pregnancy. The external evidence definitively rules out the pregnancy claim, aligning perfectly with the internal assessment.  Given the compelling evidence from both sources and the lack of any contradictory information, the confidence score is rated at 10, signifying complete certainty in the conclusion that the caption is out of context.
final_result.validation_summary: Both internal and external checks strongly and conclusively refute the caption's claim. The image shows no evidence of pregnancy, and external fact-checking confirms the rumor's falsity.  There is complete agreement between the two checks, resulting in a high confidence score.
